author: Miri Marshall
title: Extreme heat in DMV Friday | wusa9.com
text: WASHINGTON — Weather Impact Alert Details: What: - High heat and humidity. Highs: 94 - 99. Heat Index: Up to 110 degrees - Scattered strong to severe thunderstorms When: - Friday 12 p.m. until 8 p.m. for heat. - Friday 5 p.m. - 11 p.m. for storms. Impact: - Heat related illness possible - Some outdoor plans may have to be moved indoors Need to Know: - Reconsider outdoor activities - Drink plenty of non-sugary, non-alcoholic beverages -- preferably water - Check on elderly people, children and pets - Know the signs of heat related illnesses - Don't walk pets on the pavement - Close your shades or curtains The [WUSA9 Weather Team](/article/weather/forecast/weather-forecast-dmv/65-f729a838-1067-401b-a864-3c1cbb341b72) has issued a Weather Impact Alert for dangerous heat Friday and a chance for showers and storms. An Excessive Heat Warning will go into effect for the District and I-95 Corridor and points southeast, with a Heat Advisory for most of the DMV until 8 p.m. Heat and humidity combined will make it feel much hotter than the actual air temperature. The heat index could make it feel as hot as 110 degrees in some areas. In addition to the heat, there is a chance for showers and storms, anytime between 5 p.m. - 11 p.m. There is a small chance for one or two of the storms to become strong to severe, producing strong gusty winds. Some storms may also produce heavy rain, which could make it difficult to see while driving or lead to water ponding on the roads. Storms will be spaced out, so not everyone will see a storm. WUSA9 issues Weather Impact alert for dangerous or deadly weather, or even non-severe weather that may cause you to change your plans. It's our commitment to keeping our community safe. Do you have a news tip on this story or any other story? We want to hear from you. Tell us about it by emailing [newstips@wusa9.com](mailto:newstips@wusa9.com). MORE WAYS TO GET WUSA9 DOWNLOAD THE WUSA9 APP Apple App Store: WUSA9 News on Apple Google Play Store: WUSA9 News on Android HOW TO ADD THE FREE WUSA9+ APP TO YOUR STREAMING DEVICE ROKU: add the channel from the ROKU store or by searching for WUSA9. For both Apple TV and Fire TV, search for "WUSA9" to find the free app to add to your account. Another option for Fire TV is to have the app delivered directly to your Fire TV through Amazon. SIGN UP TO RECEIVE WUSA9 NEWSLETTER Subscribe to our [daily WUSA9 Newsletter](/email) for top stories from WUSA9 curated daily just for you. Get content and information right now for can’t-miss stories, Commanders content, weather, and more delivered right to your inbox.

author: Mariana Brasil
title: Haddad comemora com Janja carnes na cesta básica - 11/07/2024 - Mercado - Folha
text:
O ministro da Fazenda, Fernando Haddad , celebrou, ao lado da primeira-dama Janja , a incluso da carne na cesta bsica. A proposta original enviada por ele Cmara dos Deputados em abril deste ano no inclua o item entre os produtos que tero alquota zero na reforma tributria.
Em vdeo publicado no X (antigo Twitter ) nesta quinta-feira (11), os dois comentam a desonerao do produto, proposta que contrariava o que pensava a equipe econmica do governo e o presidente da Cmara, Arthur Lira (PP-AL).
Na tera-feira (9), o ministro disse que a ampliao do "cashback" (devoluo do imposto) na regulamentao da reforma tributria poderia compensar a ausncia de protena animal na lista de produtos da cesta bsica que tero alquota zero quando a reforma for implementada.
"O presidente Lula tambm teve sua vitria ontem. O presidente tinha feito uma manifestao pblica de que a carne tinha que estar na cesta bsica porque afinal de contas o acesso protena animal tem que ser garantido a todos os brasileiros", diz o ministro no vdeo. "Ns conseguimos vencer a oposio e colocar a carne na cesta bsica."
Ao longo da tramitao da reforma na Cmara, integrantes do governo afirmaram que Haddad no se opunha incluso da carne entre os produtos que no seriam tributados.
Apesar disso, aps reunio com Lira e lderes da Casa , o ministro disse que a ampliao do "cashback" na regulamentao da reforma tributria poderia compensar a ausncia de protena animal na lista de produtos da cesta bsica .
O presidente Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva durante lanamento do plano Safra de Agricultura familiar no Palcio do Planalto. Na foto, aparece ao lado da primeira-dama Janja e ao ministro da Fazenda, Fernando Haddad . - Gabriela Bil/Folhapress Em sua fala no vdeo, Haddad mencionou a deciso foi tomada mediante acordo entre as lideranas da Casa, incluindo o PL, que votou contra a reforma. O ministro diz ainda que o partido fez uma campanha contra a reforma, em uma linha de retrocesso e "no modernidade".
Segundo o ministro, o impacto da incluso das carnes de 0,53 ponto percentual na alquota do IVA (Imposto sobre Valor Agregado) nos clculos do governo e de 0,57 ponto percentual pela conta do Banco Mundial.
O secretrio extraordinrio da Reforma Tributria do Ministrio da Fazenda , Bernard Appy, tambm defendia que o mecanismo de cashback era o melhor caminho, e sinalizava riscos de se aumentar a lista de produtos da Cesta Bsica Nacional .
De acordo com ele, itens que tero alquota zero, poderiam correr o risco de serem usados pelas empresas para elevar a sua margem de lucro, sem que o efeito da desonerao tributria chegasse ao consumidor final.
O presidente Lula, por sua vez, defendeu a incluso da carne entre os itens da cesta bsica, vontade manifestada tambm para o ministro da Agricultura, Carlos Fvaro (PSD-MT). Lula tambm deu declaraes pblicas sobre o assunto, ao defender a iseno de impostos para o frango .
Durante lanamento do Plano Safra 2024/2025 , Lula disse ainda que os empresrios no precisam ter compromisso ideolgico com o governo e defendeu tirar imposto da carne.
O volume de protena animal consumida no pas torna a medida um forte apelo popular, alm de atender a uma das promessas de campanha de Lula, de que os brasileiros voltassem a comer carne , como a picanha.
Na publicao, a primeira-dama e o ministro iniciam o vdeo celebrando a deciso de equiparar os planos de sade para animais situao fiscal dos veterinrios, o que barateia os convnios. A Reforma prev uma alquota reduzida de 30% para esses planos, demanda acatada no final das negociaes pelo relator do projeto, deputado Reginaldo Lopes ( PT -MG).
"Para muita gente pode parecer um detalhe, mas para quem cuida do seu petzinho uma questo importante", diz Haddad.
Segundo ele e a primeira-dama, at a apresentadora Xuxa se envolveu na negociao: "A Xuxa entrou no circuito, ela entrou em contato com os empresrios que eu recebi na Fazenda", completou o ministro.

author: Leticia Quadros
title: Luana Bertolucci volta ao Orlando Pride depois de terminar tratamento contra câncer
text: A jogadora Luana Bertolucci retornou às atividades no Orlando Pride depois de terminar a quimioterapia em outubro deste ano. Luana, que também atuou pela seleção, recebeu o diagnóstico de Linfoma de Hodgkin em abril, após realizar exames detalhados. Ela foi recebida com festa pelas outras jogadoras, que levaram balões roxos - cor do Orlando Pride - e deram um presente para ela. As companheiras de equipe fizeram um prêmio, em formato de bola, com fotos de Luana junto com o time. Nas redes sociais a brasileira agradeceu o carinho. “Esse time é especial. Elas me apoiaram a cada passo nessa trajetória. É muito mais que futebol, é a família ‘pride’”, escreveu a jogadora. Desde que foi diagnosticada com o câncer, Luana teve um acompanhamento não apenas dos médicos do Orlando Pride, mas também da seleção brasileira. Nas redes sociais o Time Brasil também comemorou o retorno da jogadora, desejando que ele seja “repleto de alegrias”. Outras brasileiras também fazem parte do Orlando Pride. O principal nome é o de Marta. Além dela, Adriana, Angelina e Raffaelle completam o time, ao lado de Luana. Os comentários são exclusivos para assinantes do Estadão.

author: Gavin Pendergraff
title: Bartlesville area moving out of drought stages following heavy rainfall during Christmas weekend | News | fox23.com
text: BARTLESVILLE, Okla. — The Bartlesville area is moving out of the drought stages as water continues to flow into the city's primary water supply source, Hulah Lake, after heavy rains in southeastern Kansas during Christmas weekend. The City of Bartlesville has lifted water restrictions after heavy rains filled Hulah Lake. "Rains that started over the Christmas holiday have had a significant impact on our water supply, increasing Hulah Lake levels by 3.5 feet as of today," Water Utilities Director Terry Lauritsen said. "Now, a week later, water continues to flow into the lake. This has moved us out of all stages of the Water Shortage Ordinance for the first time since December 2022." Bartlesville's overall water remaining is 72.1%, which is about 20% higher than it was a month ago. Bartlesville city leaders say it’s not a matter of if, but when the city will have to up its water restrictions. The city is also looking into emergency water supply plans, for if the drought continues. Weighted water supply is sitting at 128% which exceeds the required 95% for stage one of the water shortage ordinance. "Because we rely most heavily on Hulah Lake for our water supply, as that is where we have the most water right, we really couldn't be in a better situation than we are now," Lauritsen said. "Hopefully, we will continue to see enough rain in the Hulah watershed to keep us out of all drought contingency plan stages as we continue to seek additional water sources to meet future weather and climate-related challenges." Some people in Bartlesville are going to be paying more for water as the town brings in restrictions and a rate increase to deal with a water shortage. Even though Bartlesville and surrounding water customers have seen an improvement, other communities that rely on Copan Lake are still struggling with drought issues. "They desperately need rain in the Copan Lake watershed area," said Lauritsen. The drought continues to wreak havoc on Bartlesville’s water supply. It’s just over half capacity leaving many families rationing their water usage.

author: greatesthitsuk
title: Amber warning for snow issued for Yorkshire with freezing weekend expected
text:
Amber warning for snow issued for Yorkshire with freezing weekend expected
The Met Office has issued a fresh warning for snow across the region
A new amber weather warning for snow and ice has been issued for Yorkshire over the weekend.
A warning for snow and freezing rain covering most of Wales and central England is in place from 6pm on Saturday to midday on Sunday, the Met Office said.
The second warning for snow, covering most of northern England including much of Yorkshire and Humberside, has been issued from 9pm on Saturday to midnight on Sunday.
Up to 30cm of snowfall is expected locally in both warning areas, with 3 to 7cm likely in other areas.
It comes after a series of yellow weather warnings were already issued across the UK by the forecaster between Friday and Monday.
UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) cold weather health alerts for all of England remain in place ahead of a week of low temperatures.
Dr Agostinho Sousa, head of extreme events and health protection at UKHSA, said: "The forecasted temperatures can have a serious impact on the health of some people, including those aged 65 and over and those with pre-existing health conditions, and it is therefore vital to check in on friends, family and neighbours that are most vulnerable.
"These people could be more at risk of heart attacks, stroke and chest infections as a result of cold temperatures."
Health Secretary Wes Streeting said on Friday it was "a weekend to layer up and put the heating on" due to the cold conditions.
He told BBC Breakfast: "We are heading into a cold snap this weekend and I know there are lots of concerns, not just amongst charity leaders, but also among NHS and social care leaders as well, about the particular risks and vulnerabilities this weekend as temperatures drop, both in terms of risk of accident and injury, but also risk from the cold itself.
"This is a weekend to wrap up and keep warm, to take sensible precautions about going out and about."
[Hear all the latest news from across the UK on the hour, every hour, on Greatest Hits Radio on DAB, smartspeaker, at greatesthitsradio.co.uk, and on the Rayo app.](http://hellorayo.co.uk/greatest-hits/play/)

author: BUSINESSTODAY
title: '100+ volcanoes under Antarctica': Melting ice a ticking time bomb, warn scientists
text:
Produced by: Mohsin Shaikh
Beneath Antarctica’s icy façade lies a massive network of over 100 active volcanoes, kept in check by the crushing weight of ice. But as the ice melts, the threat of eruptions looms closer.
Representative pic
A study in Geochemistry, Geophysics, Geosystems reveals how melting ice is reducing pressure on magma chambers, destabilizing them and potentially triggering volcanic eruptions.
As ice thins, the Earth’s crust loses its suppressive weight. Magma decompression begins, releasing trapped gases, which increase internal pressure and the likelihood of eruptions.
Volcanic eruptions generate heat that melts more ice, which in turn exposes more bedrock and allows magma to rise, creating a self-sustaining cycle of fire and ice.
Representative pic
Antarctica’s volcanic awakening isn’t just a local threat. Rising sea levels and injected volcanic gases, like CO2, could alter weather systems and accelerate global warming.
West Antarctica’s melting ice sheet could raise sea levels by several meters, but volcanic heat could cause the destabilized sheet to collapse faster than current predictions suggest.
Ash and aerosols from under-ice eruptions may disrupt atmospheric conditions, warming the Southern Ocean and compounding the climate crisis on a global scale.
Representative pic
Scientists warn that even if human emissions stopped, the melting and eruption cycle could perpetuate itself, making this a long-term, autonomous threat.
Representative pic
Advanced monitoring technologies, including satellite imaging and remote sensing, are essential to track Antarctic volcanic activity and prepare for the cascading impacts of this hidden danger.
Representative pic

author: Автор Анастасия Благая
title: В автомобилях китайского производства обнаружили излучение, способное вызывать онкозаболевания - RuNews24.ru - 14.08.2025
text:
Учёные обнаружили опасные уровни излучения в салоне при разгоне, особенно в китайских гибридах. Напряжённость электрического поля достигает 200 В/м, что в восемь раз превышает допустимые нормы. Это может вызвать онкологические заболевания, неврологические нарушения и депрессию.
Мойка78 пишет, что электромобили и гибриды создают мощные электромагнитные поля из-за мощных систем и высоковольтных проводов. В обычных автомобилях излучение периодическое, в электромобилях — постоянное.
Исследователи рекомендуют улучшить систему электромагнитной защиты в гибридных автомобилях.
Исследование не указывает конкретную модель автомобиля, но результаты могут быть применимы ко всем китайским гибридам.
Этот анализ появился на фоне новостей о высокой доле китайских автомобилей на складах российских дилеров (200–250 тысяч) из-за повышения утилизационного сбора. В 2025 году продажи китайских авто снизились на 25,3% из-за высокой ключевой ставки и дорогих автокредитов.
Российское автопроизводство также сталкивается с проблемами: переполненные склады, четырёхдневная рабочая неделя на заводах и снижение продаж российских машин.
Будущее автопрома в России зависит от экономической ситуации и стоимости автомобилей.
